S1.T2.caption: Table 2: Comparison of distributed and compressed algorithms using stochastic gradients for nonconvex problems. Communication rounds refers to the number of compressed messages transmitted between clients and the server.
references: To the best of our knowledge, this work is the first to answer the above question affirmatively. Our specific contributions are as follows.
we propose Power-EF, a new distributed SGD algorithm that contains a novel error-feedback mechanism for communication compression.
we prove that, with high probability, Power-EF converges to
stochastic gradient queries and communication rounds. The algorithm shows a linear speedup pattern in that the convergence rate benefits with the increase of the number of workers
we prove that, with high probability, Power-EF escapes the saddle points and converges to

stochastic gradient queries and communication rounds. This suggests that Power-EF finds second-order stationary points with almost the same order of gradient and communication complexities as it takes to for first-order convergence.
importantly, the theory of Power-EF does not require assumptions on data similarity between different clients, thus allowing arbitrary heterogeneity in federated learning tasks.
for a detailed comparison between our proposed method and existing algorithms.
